About Project CARS

Project CARS is a motorsport racing simulator video game developed by Slightly Mad Studios and published and distributed by Bandai Namco Entertainment .

Project CARS Time Attack is a companion app that aims to enhance the single player experience. It compares and saves sector times, laptimes and time differences for different combinations of cars and tracks.

Welcome to Project CARS Time Attack!

pCARS-TA has two modes: Session and Live Database.

Session shows a list of laptimes and sectors for each lap during a single session. It highlights the best sectors, best laptime for the session and the all time record for the car/track combination.

Live Database mode shows a list of all the records for the different car/track combinations and the total number of laps for each combo. It allows you to sort the list by car, laptime or total number of laps driven for each car/track. It also has an option to filter the list by car class. If one track is selected, only laptimes for that specific track are shown (including a chart with time differences). Live Database updates its content in real-time.

Ghost mode shows sector and laptime differences between your current lap and your last, best or record lap, or any other record in your database in real time.

Problems running pCARS-TA?

These are a few things you could try:

1. Make sure your WiFi is on and connected to the same network as your game console.

2. In game options/system, select UDP frequency 5 and UDP Protocol Project CARS 1.

3. pCARS-TA uses your network\'s broadcast address to communicate with the game. You can enter it manually in settings and deactivate the auto mode if this automatic broadcast discovery is not working for your network.

4.Important: Uninstalling the app will delete all your records from the database! In the full version there is an option in the settings menu that helps you backup/restore the database to a file in the Downloads folder of your device. This can also be used to transfer records between Android devices.

5. There is an option in setting to delete laptimes from the database. This can not be accessed during a race session.

6. One more thing, pCARS-TA just listens to the information that the game wants to share. Sometimes the car and track information can take a few laps to show up. Do not worry, all your laptimes get stored in memory until the car/track information is available. If the app loses focus, it loses the information for the session, including the laps that were in memory waiting for the car/track information from the game.

Note about Reset Session: There are times when the app is not able to tell where the player is at in the game. For example, during replays or when jumping from practice to qualifying and into the race. In those occasions we can use the option Reset Session in the options menu. That will keep the track and car configuration but will reset the laptimes for the session.

Enjoy!
